Ecommerce Manager

Company Name Diamond Talent Company Location Collins St, Melbourne Victoria 3000

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 66 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Do you love luxury retailing? Are you looking for an opportunity to work with business owners to build and execute their online marketing strategy? Are you ready to take on your next challenge and really see what you can do?


About the Company
This family owned business prides itself on its legacy. Here the ethos is to be charming and humble, yet confident in its dealings with customers. They offer only the best menswear brands from all over the world. For customers, a visit to their stores is an event and the retail experience is exceptional. \xa0

About this role
This is an opportunity to take a leading role in the development and expansion of the company’s online presence. You will work closely with the company’s owners and marketing team to come up with creative online campaigns and execute these. You will have the support of the wider team operating from the company’s luxury flag ship store on Collins Street. This is an opportunity to deliver cross-platform content in line with company’s sales and communications calendars. You will get a rush from seeing the success of your initiatives. Your interpretation of onsite & social analytics will help to drive project outcomes. You will love being in the drivers seat!


What you need to apply

  • Exposure to Shopify and Apparel 21 is ideal.
  • You will also need to be able to manage EDM’s and marketing campaigns.
  • Ability to manage the company’s ecommerce platform, including content creation, customer services, fulfillment and shipping.
  • Alignment of eCommerce strategy in support of the wider business strategy
  • You will need to have a working knowledge of google analytics, PPC and other relevant tools.


What they are offering
They are offering a competitive salary plus benefits. A great working environment and a close knit, supportive team. An opportunity for you to be rewarded for your success with incentives.

If you want to join this league of distinguished gentlemen, here is your chance.

GRAB IT! This role will fill quickly.

\xa0

Please email your application directly to me: cherine@diamondtalent.com.au

Or call for a confidential chat 0412655732

Payroll Admin | Melbourne

Company Name AIA Australia Company Location Melbourne

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 26 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

WE’RE FOR your growth…

At AIA Australia we focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have all the opportunities to reach your full potential. Join one of Asia Pacific’s largest life insurers that is committed to your personal and professional growth.

Join the People and Culture team as a Payroll Administrator and build on your experience and career with AIA Australia. This role is responsible for data integrity, reporting and system administration for the Peoplesoft (HR) and Share plan systems.

Key duties and responsibilities include:

  • Data entry of employee data into Peoplesoft including new employee set up as well as variation of employment
  • Resolving /answering queries relating to PeopleSoft HR data data
  • Successful synchronization of data between PeopleSoft and Chris21
  • Administration of PeopleSoft org structure and position management
  • Propose and initiate the undertaking of projects and change management programs associated with improving operational efficiency and service delivery
  • Participating in testing for major application software changes
  • Preparing management (local and Group) reports and as per ad hoc reporting requests
  • Assist the payroll team in managing employee records and Payroll email inbox
  • Maintain relevant employee share data in Computershare systems

To be successful in this role you must have experience with entering and managing data in HR or payroll system. Knowledge of PeopleSoft HR system and related modules is highly desirable as well as the ability to cope with high volumes of work, manage competing priorities and meet negotiated deadlines. You will be flexible in your approach and customer focused.

WE’RE FOR your wellbeing…

We understand healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing, inclusion and flexibility. With fruit box deliveries, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership (including a FitBit!), we endorse work-life balance.

WE’RE FOR your recognition…

We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.

WE’RE FOR your success…

Your success is ours. Not only do we provide you with all the resources for you to thrive, we enable you to be the best that you can be. We encourage creative thinking and you will even be rewarded for it!

WE’RE FOR you…

If you would like further information on this role including a position description please contact vanessa.hofman@aia.com Applications close 07.09.2018

Product Development and Innovation Manager, Talent Management

Company Name Hudson Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 142 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Exciting innovation role working with leading talent management tools
  • Create bespoke talent solutions and services for blue-chip clients
  • Help change people's lives as you grow and develop your own career


At Hudson our vision is to reimagine talent solutions; harnessing the world's best data driven insights to accelerate performance in the evolving world of work.


Hudson Talent Management offers solutions that are underpinned by psychology and data analytics. We deliver innovative, competitive and industry-leading results for our clients across candidate profiling and assessment, leadership development and outplacement and redeployment.


We are looking for someone with strong expertise in product development and technology, to drive innovation and product development initiatives for our assessment, leadership and change and transition tools and solutions across the APAC Talent Management practice.


In this role you will be visible and impactful. Leading and managing the product roadmap and owning the product development strategy, you will adopt best practice approaches to rapid product development, producing cutting edge new solutions and tools which support the business to win market share. You will be the go-to person for information on industry trends and emerging technology in our industry and will work closely with the Senior Leadership Team, the Operations team, PMO, IT and Marketing to drive and influence business decisions based on data and metrics.


You are:

  • A risk taker; someone who will drive an innovation mindset, facilitate experimentation, and rapid learning.
  • Experienced in product development, having at least 5 years of expertise ideally within the HR or talent management space.
  • Experienced working end-to-end across the product lifecycle; we want you to have done this all before and guide us on best practice.
  • Driven to build amazing products with the best user experience and you're comfortable acting as a conduit between technical and non-technical people.
  • Technically savvy, ideally with some software engineering expertise.
  • An analytical thinker: using data to inform your decision making is second nature to you and the opportunity to create data-driven insights is what gets you going in the morning.
  • Curious, excited and inspired by a challenge, and motivated to solve problems in a team that takes their work seriously, but not themselves.
  • A strong communicator who will build strong working relationships with key stakeholders and confident working with people of all seniority levels


Why Hudson?

  • You'll join a connected powerhouse of knowledge; leveraging best-in-class, innovative and leading organisational psychology practices.
  • Join the largest privately-owned talent solutions company in Asia Pacific, with an array of Talent Management offerings, giving you more opportunities to develop your career the way you want to.
  • Be empowered to succeed, in a collaborative and fun team environment where we celebrate each other's success.


Sound like you?


Apply today, or get in touch with Kaela Hindle on +6427 506 5891 or kaela.hindle@hudson.com for a confidential conversation.


Learn more about life at Hudson at www.hudson-careers.com.


WEAREHUDSON

Our client is a dynamic and innovative market leader who is currently enjoying a period of significant growth and expansion. As a result of their growth, they are now looking to add a high calibre Finance & Corporate Services Manager to the team.

Reporting to the Managing Director, your role will be broad and diverse requiring you to work across the group to drive financial and operational excellence. More specifically, you will partner with the leadership teams across HR, IT and Finance to ensure robust systems and processes that will enable the business to grow sustainably.

Leading a small finance and administrative team, you will be responsible for financial and management reporting, cash flow management, human resources and business systems. You will play a lead role in ensuring the business is strategically aligned and that people continue to develop and grow within their roles.

CA/CPA qualified, you will be an engaging leader who enjoys working in a fast-paced and agile environment. You are likely to have worked in similar broad leadership roles and you will enjoy variety. You will be energetic and driven and will enjoy interacting and engaging with a range of stakeholders.

This is an excellent opportunity to join this innovative market leader as they continue to grow and expand. You will be joining a company with a fantastic culture who prides themselves on flexibility in the workplace.

The opportunity

Joining our team as a Contracts Quality Advisor, you will lead the delivery of specialist services and inspire our technical teams to produce products and systems that help us become a vibrant and more progressive utility.

Engineering Cadets
Job ID: 553350
Job type: Full Time - Permanent
Location: Melbourne
Categories: Engineering (All disciplines), Cadetships

Who We Are

Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure and facilities.

Downer has over 100 years’ experience delivering total rail asset solutions for its passenger and freight customers. We have an extensive national footprint with approximately 20 sites across Australia.

Position Summary

As a part of the Evolution Rail consortium, Downer is excited to be delivering the High Capacity Metro Trains (HCMT) Project, which is Victoria’s largest ever investment in rolling stock, and a complex, landmark project that will transform the State’s manufacturing industry.

The HCMT project consists of design, manufacture/construction, commissioning and maintenance of 65 trains, 2 simulators, a depot consisting of a train maintenance facility and stabling yard at East Pakenham, and a light service facility at Calder Park.

The project has created an exciting opportunity for Downer Engineering Cadets to gain exposure to world class rolling stock engineering and manufacturing practices.

Duties And Responsibilities

During the cadetship program participants will undertake:
  • Rotational placement across various engineering functions where you will receive extensive exposure to the overall HCMT project and senior engineers in the organisation.
  • Exposure to the lifecycle of engineering project management incorporating contractual requirements, engineering design, engineering refinement, systems engineering, testing, acceptance and verification, and validation of engineering requirements.
  • A mentor program where you will be partnered with a senior leader in the business who will support you throughout the cadet program.

Professional development activities; development areas will include professional workplace behaviours, networking skills, leadership skills and exposure to the 4 Pillars of Downer.

Knowledge/Skills Required

Candidates will possess the following skills:
  • A willingness to learn
  • Strong communication skills
  • The ability to adapt to a rapid project environment.


Technical Skills (if Applicable)

Downer is seeking applicants form a range of tertiary backgrounds including:
  • Mechanical Engineering
  • Electrical Engineering
  • ICT Engineering
  • Design Engineering
  • Project Engineering discipline
How to apply
To apply for this great opportunity please click the apply now button

Closing Date: 31 Oct 2018 AUS Eastern Daylight Time
